main event: An unidentified object was observed hovering over water at about 1,000 feet for approximately 2 minutes, then climbed out of sight at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The object was described as a 22.800 round object that was maneuvering.
The object was tracked on air-visual radar, but then disappeared from the radar.
A separate incident was reported from Veracruz, where a luminous object almost as bright as the sun hovered overhead for a long time before suddenly disappearing.
The Veracruz incident was presumed to be an artificial satellite, and the authorities were asked to identify it.
The sighting in the first report lasted for approximately 2 minutes.
